subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Revenue-First: Selling Before You're Ready
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Revenue-First: Selling Before You're Ready.

hook.text: Basecamp charged customers from day one. They never needed a dime of outside money.

buildup.text: Revenue-first companies prioritize getting paid over getting funded.

discovery.text: Customer revenue is the best funding: no dilution, no board seats, no pressure to exit.

twist.text: VC-backed competitors move faster initially. But funded startups burn; revenue startups compound.

climax.text: GitHub bootstrapped for four years, reaching $100M ARR before finally raising venture capital.

punchline.text: The best investor is a paying customer.

quiz.question: Why is customer revenue considered the best form of startup funding?
options: It requires no equity dilution and validates real demand simultaneously
It's the fastest way to grow a company
Investors prefer companies that are already profitable
